Reviews.Title: “Good location in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: BEW64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk from all things in downtown Phoenix--Diamondbacks, Suns, Convention Center, Science Center, theaters, other more expensive hotels (where they host conferences). They have a hotel shuttle so you can avoid renting a car if you plan to remain in the downtown area during your stay. The room was comfortable although the furniture is a little cheap--saggy couch and mattress. Very spacious though, nice LCD TV, I like the fridge/microwave/sink and desk area...and the A/C works well! The breakfast is pretty basic but it's free. The marketplace has some snacks and drinks which can come in handy in a pinch. They have a pool too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Julie K
Reviews.Content: This is a popular hotel to stay in for the Diamond Backs games as it is very close to the field. Don't waste your money. It is very expensive and not nice at all. We arrived late to the hotel and went straight up to the room. The hallway smelled like a hospital and so did the room. Very unpleasant. The bed was saggy in the middle and uncomfortable. After getting to bed late the alarm clock in the room began blaring country music at 5am. We awoke again later to the fact that there was no hot water! NONE! The problem was not remedied by the time of checkout. It was awful and we have received no apology or compensation for our ordeal. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: CrystalLuna
Reviews.Content: As a high school event chaperone, I appreciated the staff's efficiency at check-in. All the clean, spacious rooms were blocked together and ready early for the 21 students and 2 chaperones. Easy walk to our event at the Phoenix Convention Center. Hotel has shuttle to downtown/airport as well. The breakfast was above average in variety and quality. The staff was pleasant and very helpful to the students. Definitely made my job easier. No time to enjoy the amenities unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: kian22
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, spacious, well stocked and very very nice. The breakfast had lots of variety and plenty to eat. I did use the small gym, it was okay. The only complaint I had was the smell inside the lobby which came from the Elevator Electrical Room which I was told. It made me nervous to see large fans blowing on the panels, glad my room was downstairs. The smell at times would make me queasy, but I could not smell it in my room. The staff was pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sewkitty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this location for two nights. The hotel room was spacious, clean and well kept up. Although in a previous review there was a complaint about premade eggs, I have to say this is not "that hotel that makes eggs to each individual taste". The breakfast selection consisted of the above premade eggs, sausage, waffles, hot oatmeal, a variety of cold cereals, muffins, doughnuts, bagels, and yoghurt. Plenty of hot coffee, tea and two kinds of juices. The only drawback to this hotel is that there are many restaurants we would have liked to have tried but no parking unless you parked in a parking structure if nearby and then walk. It was on check out when I mentioned this and was then told a hotel shuttle was available for a dropoff/pick up within a 3 mile radius. Too late, we were leaving!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place if the Company is Paying!”
Reviews.Author: retdeltee
Reviews.Content: Spent the last 2 weeks here on business. There's no place like home and this ain't home! Clean enough, not that quiet, and depending on your expectation of breakfast, it's your call; but instant scrambled eggs and mystery meat with an insta waffle don't make it! Coffee is good and there is packaged cereal and breads available. Friendly and helpful staff, more than enough parking, lighted parking lot. Nice walk to the center of town, 10-15 minutes. Slow Internet, either WiFi or cable. Comfortable enough beds and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad it's the only Marriott property downtown”
Reviews.Author: Ken H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before but this was the first time in a couple of years. It is NOT again well. Both the rooms and the common areas need some freshening up and TLC. Nothing big was wrong, but lots of little things. Drippy shower that wouldn't stop, badly bruised fruit, stale baked goods and cold, pre-formed eggs at breakfast, soft mattress, noisy elevators that we could hear in our room well down the hall, carpet and drapes starting to wear. Also, even though this is a "suites" hotel, it's really not functional as one. The sink in essentially in the room, so that it's impossible to get ready in the morning but let another person sleep. It's made worse by a large mirror that reflects light right back at the bed. Prefunctory front desk "service". It wasn't a disaster, but I'm sure we can do better in Downtown Phoenix and won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “A place to go”
Reviews.Author: massiniezcurra
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night at this hotel and it was enough to notice how well managed it is. The cleanliness in all areas, rooms, linen, towells is remarkable. Breakfast was well stuffed and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is within walking distance from downtown Phoenix. The parking place is ample and free. Beds were very comfortable. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “walking distance to Chase Field”
Reviews.Author: Glenda H
Reviews.Content: Our visit to SpringHill Suites was very pleasant. The hotel was very clean. The rooms were spacious and the staff was very helpful. Our room had two tvs and a sitting area which gave the three of us plenty of room to navigate. We had tickets to the Diamondbacks game that night and we were able to walk to the field and avoid any parking fees at the ball game. We would stay there again. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, right downtown”
Reviews.Author: johnmc82
Reviews.Content: Good Marriot property right in downtown Phoenix - walking distance to the Convention Center, sports venues, science museum and observatory. Spent 2 nights - rates very reasonable, although we stayed on points. When there was a snag with Marriot Rewards regarding this reservation being on points, the front desk was very friendly and helpful in quickly resolving the issue. Good breakfast area and morning fare. Phoenix is a beautiful city and we walked from the hotel to the Capital and back in the early morning before the heat! Clean comfortable room, all the usual ammenities. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if your going to the game”
Reviews.Author: aprkontra
Reviews.Content: Went to see a baseball game at Chase Field, this was a great hotel to stay at...Nothing over the top, the price is excellent. The rooms are suites, you have a small type of den with a couch & comfortable chair...two flat screen TV's... you have a Microwave, Refrigerator, Coffee Maker... and a sink... there are no Bars or Restaurants, but they do have decent breakfast: milk, cereal, muffins, bagels, juice, coffee, eggs and turkey sausage patty, actually for free it wasn't that bad... small pool, everything is clean... would stay here again without a doubt. The front desk was extremely helpful... the location close the Chase and many restaurants... I would not recommend Sam's Cafe, but I would recommend Kincaid's,,, this place was GREAT...I highly recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMartinOriginals
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Quiet hotel - Nice room and decor, roomy space - Separate bed/living room areas - Service was attentive. It took me 2 minutes to check in and 15 seconds to check out - Good breakfast. Eggs, waffles, fruit, cereals, etc. Negatives: - None that I can think of !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a visit to the ballpark”
Reviews.Author: redladya
Reviews.Content: Nice room, free parking, great pool & jacuzzi! Just about 2 1/2 blocks to the baseball stadium. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “peace at last”
Reviews.Author: hkosovich
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone doing business at the convention center or seeing a baseball/basketball game. it's walking distance (3-5 short blocks) phoenix downtown. hotel is extremely immaculate, everything in room is up-to-date, functioning properly and quite QUIET. great for business travel with free wi-fi and breakfast. Has small exercise room and pool (3-5' deep) and outdoor jacuzzi. Definitely worth considering. Thank you for a great, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: daytripper040
Reviews.Content: considering how many hotels in large american cities charge for parking, this one, on the edge of downtown is worth considering. along with the breakfast and the in room internet, i thought is was value, especially on an ebreak Marriott weekend promotion. breakfast is typical of Marriott and the staff were professional. just dont expect any fireworks downtown, the place resembles a military curfew imposed at 6pm, i have never seen a more desolate concrete canyon in a large city...

Reviews.Title: “Typical - well priced, clean - free breakfeast & good front desk”
Reviews.Author: Tech-trekker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and the only problem was the classic internet speed slow-down experienced in virtually every hotel I stay in when most people get on the web at night. When staying in downtown, you either pay to park in a lot or feed a meter. Parking at the hotel is free and plentiful. Liked having a second sink and microwave at the wet bar area. Two TV's but a few channels were snowy.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: themil62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my significant other for a night in August. Being very spoiled in regards to hotels and resorts this place has just nothing to offer. Downtown Phoenix deserves a great hotel. This one just as bland as all the others in the area. Nothing special. Rooms are boring, no lobby, no atmosphere. If you are looking for a sheltered bed - this is the place for you, if you're looking for a "hotel", go to Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, especially for DBacks-Suns”
Reviews.Author: Huntersville
Reviews.Content: Pretty surprising to find a new SpringHill Suites 4 blocks from Chase Field (home of the MLB Diamondbacks) with free parking, breakfast & wi-fi for $89. Walked to the game and never felt unsafe (I'm told not to walk in the other direction), room was great, breakfast good. Best value of a 6-motel trip out west!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dojsnowin
Reviews.Content: stay for 6 days, was great, nice room with pull out sofa bed and small sink and refrig. stayed with spouse and teenage son. it was very hot, but that phoenix in july. location good for conference center. here are the good points. shuttle to and from airport at no cost. shuttle to and from conference city at no charge. free internet service. all other hotels sheraton & hyatt charge for pick up at airport and internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good for price, would stay at again.”
Reviews.Author: doozie123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night. We by far liked this hotel than other hotel we stayed in while in Arizona. We loved room size, separate kitchen/living room and bedroom. Nice jacuzzi. It was 2 blocks from Arizona Center which has shops and restaurants in it. It was clean and we were not able to hear our neighbors. The complimentary breakfast was Great- quite the spread- eggs, bacon, waffles you could make yourself, yogurt etc, What wasn't so great- it was off a main street and we could hear trucks, motorcycles go by.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: soutwesttraveler
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. The rooms are spacious, and the beds are so very comfortable! The location isn't in the best part of Phoenix, but we felt pretty safe. It's great if you want to be in the center of everything! I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Obvious why Springhill Suites are near the bottom of the Marriott family of hotels”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianEye
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights while here on business one day and she attended a convention the next three. Marriott in name only, this could be any cheap chain hotel. While billed as a "suite", room was just long and narrow with no separation between sleeping area and "living" area. Rooms were clean, but furnished cheaply. Desk was rickety, thought it might collapse if bumped too hard. Small tube TV, cable reception was not be best. Mini-fridge and microwave in room. Washcloths among the thinnest I've seen although the towels were OK. In south facing room wall mounted A/C needed to be on constantly, even with outside temperatures in the high 60's, low 70's. (Ask for room facing north, odd number rooms, for cooler rooms and less street noise.) "Exercise center" a tiny room with only a bicycle, treadmill, stepper, and universal gym and was not available the first day while the universal gym was being repaired. Came back the next day and the universal gym was gone. Free breakfast but "eggs" were horrible, bacon barely cooked and extremely greasy, sausage patties bland, oatmeal consistent, stick with cereals, yogurt, and various muffins. Parking was free and ample. Relatively convenient to walk several blocks to downtown area; my wife walked to the Convention Center every day. Arizona Center is three blocks due west, with a wide range of restaurants and a large 24 screen theater. We stayed on Marriott points, but this is probably a decent less-expensive alternative to more expensive high-rise downtown hotels if cost is a factor.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the Price”
Reviews.Author: funhole
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on a business trip to Phoenix in Nov 2009. We had flown out early and stayed here because the price was right and we were footing the bill, not the company. I stayed in a large suite with a king size bed, a couch, a desk area and small kitchenette. The room actually had two TVs, one by the couch and one by the bed. The TVs were not flat screen but old, tube ones and the reception on the TVs was horrible on one of them. The room was utilitarian, clean and comfortable but not brand new or updated. There was free wired, 100mbps Internet access in the rooms. My room faced a 4 lane city boulevard which at first I thought would be an issue, but there was little or no traffic on this street at any hour, so everything was fine. In fact, there seemed to be no one in this hotel besides us and a few other people. It seemed very empty but it was very quiet. I was on the second floor and had no problems with the elevators. The check in process was pretty quick and there was one front office clerk who was very friendly. He pointed out several sports bars where we could go to check out the World Series game that night. He also acts as the Concierge I guess. The lobby area is small but updated and also served as the breakfast area in the morning. There is an airport shuttle but there are specific hours and you have to alert the front desk that you want to use it. There is ample parking. There is free breakfast with alot of variety but it's a quantity selection vs. quality. If you stick to the breads, cereals, fruits, etc. and stay away from the powered eggs, it's fine. The hotel is several blocks from the "downtown" area and right next to the Univ. of Az Downtown Phoenix campus and close to the convention center. Overall, this hotel is an adequate, clean place to stay for the price. The rooms are roomy for the price and it has free Internet access. It's not trendy or updated and lacks style and ambience but it's clean and quiet and perfect for business travelers. The hotel is about 20 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: MvGel
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here. The rooms are narrow and definitely than those in other "suites" hotels. But everything was clean and service was excellent. Location is good for business travelers, maybe less so for tourists. The free breakfast was a step above typical free breakfasts, with milk and a wafflemaker. Sodas and snacks are available for purchase across from the front desk. Parking was free and plentiful. TV channels were limited. Beds and linens were fresh and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: wiffany
Reviews.Content: I was a 30 y/o female traveling alone during my stay at this hotel. The hotel's location is great if you want to be near the airport without feeling like you're near the airport, if you want to be downtown (and near public transportation like the light rail) or near sporting events. However, I was warned by hotel staff and folks from the area not to go east of the hotel, as the neighborhood isn't as safe in that direction. Good advice. After learning my way around, I was comfortable walking west of the hotel to the Arizona Center where there are some shops, restaurants and a movie theatre. The hotel has a parking lot (at no extra charge) that I used since I rented a car, a small outdoor pool and a business center with 2 computers and 2 printers. It also has a small fitness room, but I did not use it. My room was sufficient - nice actually, since it was a suite. King size bed, sink area with a small fridge, microwave and counter, a fold out sofa, desk with chair and a nice sized bathroom. Some pluses about this hotel are the business center and the continental breakfast (juices, milk, cereal, yogurt, waffle maker, muffins and other breads, eggs, sausage, and other condiments), although it would have been nice to have more variety (different selections on different days) and fresh fruit. Also, a small, but extra thing - they provide towels by the pool so you don't have to bring your own. And a nice touch is the bowl of lollipops at the front desk. Some negatives about the hotel - although they have a complimentary shuttle to/from the airport - it isn't 24 hours. This isn't mentioned anywhere online so be sure to ask if that is important to you and you have an early or late flight. Also, since this hotel is right downtown, if you're looking for nightlife, PHX shuts down after 5pm. There are still restaurants, bars, and clubs - but it's not like a NYC or DC. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel - the staff was nice and the price was decent. I would stay here again if I traveled to PHX.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat experience”
Reviews.Author: chester6212
Reviews.Content: Was in Phoenix for a week long conference and decided on Springhill Suites over the closer hotels, which was an excellent choice. This hotel is located right on the main street leading to the convention center, the stadium and other downtown locations. We thought traffic would be a problem - which it wasn't. It was a very easy walk to the venue, just keep the heat in mind and stay hydrated. The folks at the front desk were top notch, no matter what we asked of them. Our reservations were messed up but they took care of the slight hitch no questions. We showed up from the airport early and were promptly given a room. The rooms were typical SS rooms, sitting area and wet bar/frig/microwave separated by a small half wall from the bath/bed and closet. The bed has to be the most comfortable we've slept on in a while. Extra pillows were asked for with our reservations and promptly supplied as we were bringing our luggage up. Everyone we dealt with smiled and spoke. We were supplied with maps and directions to the surrounding areas, along with suggested places to eat. The A/C ran on high the whole time, to counter ther 110+ heat and never missed a beat. The pool area was also a welcome retreat for the heat. The only things we could mention that caused the rating to drop from excellent to very good were: - no flat screen TV, just a plain 19" that we constantly had to adjust the volume on - our room was adjacent to the elevator and they tended to make a whining sound when they moved. It wasn't bad enough to us, to warrant a different room, but to some, it might have been. - breakfast was free and filling, with plenty to chose from, however the eggs seemed 'different', always scrambled and in a perfect circle. We stayed clear from them and stuck with the waffles, yogurt and fruit. Other comments: Skyharbor Airport is the most accomodating aiport I've been through. All of the rental car companies are away from the terminal and there is a shuttle that runs constantly. Note, Thrifty personnel were the most rude and unpleasant people we dealt with and warranted a complaint to their headquarters. They only had one car left, refused to upgrade and stuck me with a piece of junk Caliber. The Arizona Center appears to be in business just for the 'tourists', with the small souviner type shops welcoming folks from each convention. There seemed to be more empty or going out of business signs than open stores. We ate at several of the restaurants, they were okay, nothing to write home about. The folks at the front desk suggested riding to Tempe where there was anything to satisfy you appetite.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, prime location--this hotel is the very BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: Daschmo
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. First, considering the difficulty this traveler routinely experiences trying to fall asleep in a strange bed with a weird pillow, SpringHill somehow got it ALL right. Each queen bed was perfectly firm and covered by six pillows that seemed excessive at first until I realized each pillow was slightly different. I found one much like my own and slept like a baby on the ohso soft sheets. Goodbye jet lag. Bathroom was clean and the shower really woke me up, unlike many with showerheads that barely trickle. Towels soft and abundant. Couch and coffee table and desk and kitchenette. Honestly, all were great and, believe me, I am hypercritical! Breakfast provided good variety for this healthy eating traveler, offering oatmeal, fruit, whole grain bread and yogurt in addition to typical Continental fare. Coffee excellent! Suckers from Mexico in a huge bowl at the front desk were to die for! Staff very accomodating. Pool and jacuzzi looked great although I didn't use them, nor did I use the small but well-equipped fitness room. Located near campus, museums, shopping, restaurants and the ball park, we left the car parked and took walking tours for two days. There is much to do for singles, families, couples in this downtown neighborhood. We felt perfectly safe walking there after dark. This hotel seems conveniently located near highways, 10 minutes or less from the airport. We visited a great mall in Scottsdale, Ikea and a couple of outlet malls. I can't wait to go back and would definitely choose this hotel for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tntands
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the tail end of a trip to Sedona, the Grand Canyon and southwest Utah. This was a great hotel. The pool area was nice, the room was large and clean and the breakfast was good. The location was excellent. My son and I walked to the Diamondbacks game in about 10 minutes and my wife and daughter walked to the Arizona Center to eat and shop. I would stay here anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience to Chase Field”
Reviews.Author: gg99
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, including attending a game at Chase Field one of the nights. The biggest advantage of this hotel is its convenience to the ballpark - it's just a 3 - 4 block walk. The hotel itself was OK. I think calling their rooms "suites" is quite generous - the room is reasonably large, but to me, a suite is 2 rooms, not a sitting area plus a bed area. And only one small TV for the combo of the 2 areas made it difficult to watch TV after my young child went to sleep. The pluses: bathroom was good sized (split the toilet/shower vs. the sink), with good water pressure (despite high floor). The staff was very accommodating, allowing us to use their office computer to print our boarding passes for a flight when the business center was busy. Also, while I have seen some complaints about their breakfast offerings, I had no problems with them - it was the usual stuff, including bagels, muffins, yogurt, sausage and egg patties, etc. Coffee was very good and available at all times. Overall, I would say that if you will be going to a baseball game, this is a very good choice. If not, there are more luxurious places, with nicer facilities (e.g. pool, fitness center - these are rather small at the Springhill).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, large room, short walk to Convention Center.”
Reviews.Author: PG_Arch
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews and proximity to the downtown convention center, I chose Springhill Suites for a three-night stay to attend a conference. The hotel is a short ride from the airport, with a reliable and courteous complimentary shuttle service. You can call the hotel from the free phones in the airport’s ground transportation and information area and be picked up a short walk away at the shuttle station. I booked the room directly through the hotel’s front desk, after being told by the Marriott reservation center that no rooms were available. Don’t take no for an answer from Marriott’s 1-800 number; spend a few cents on the toll call directly to the hotel. Not only did I find a room, but I got it at a much lower rate of $148/night. The room was quite spacious. You first enter a living area with sofa bed, coffee table and a nook for the kitchenette (bar sink, fridge, microwave and storage) and a nice sized desk (free internet was available through an Ethernet connection at the desk, cable provided). Towards the outside wall is the bedroom space, with two queen beds. There were two televisions within the room, though both were older, standard screens. (No widescreen, flat LCD’s here yet.) There was a nice clock radio, too. The large bathroom has the sink and vanity counter separate from the toilet shower compartment. The complimentary breakfast was good, with a nice variety of hot and cold food. Strangely, I avoided the waffle maker in favor of hot oatmeal each morning. The dining area just off the front lobby is a little tight on space, but pleasant enough. Reading a complimentary copy of the Wall Street Journal was a breakfast bonus. I also took advantage of the small Jacuzzi/hot tub outside at the rear of the building. The surroundings are nothing special, but it worked fine. Although located along a main street, the neighborhood was very quiet. I walked the four blocks from the convention center in 10-15 minutes, taking pleasant shortcuts through the ASU campus or the park at the Catholic church. It’s an even shorter walk to the Arizona Center, where you can choose from half a dozen restaurants, including an average Tex Mex place and a pretty good Greek restaurant. I also caught a movie at the AMC 24-plex. I was surprised how deserted the whole downtown area was, both during the day and evening. I noticed that the baseball stadium is only a few blocks away, and the arena is just the other side of the convention center. There is also a relatively new light rail (trolley) system that people are still getting used to. Overall I was very pleased with this hotel – clean, well organized, spacious room, very good service, and convenient to the convention center. I saved a significant amount compared to the Hyatt or Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pick for Suns games at US Airways Center”
Reviews.Author: cmhsieh54
Reviews.Content: Most of the info in the existing reviews is still very up-to-date as of Feb 28-March 1, 2009, when I stayed at the SpringHills Suites Phoenix Downtown. My main purpose for the trip to Phoenix was to attend a Suns basketball game at the US Airways Center. The lobby was very presentable, if you are visiting and you are planning to meet friends/colleagues/interviewers there. Very clean and spacious, with a few large plasma TV's. The room was very clean, I was very happy with my liberal control of the air conditioning, the staff was generally very polite, and the free shuttle to/from airport was great. Add to that the close proximity to the US Airways Center, and for me, this hotel really cannot be beat. A lot of space (my room was identical to GumboK's, see his pics). In my room was a small microwave, small fridge, and even a small kitchen sink (I posted a pic). Wireless internet was perfect, and it was completely free. I dipped into the jacuzzi in the pool area. The water was clean and at a great very warm temperature. No complaints there, it's what I would expect from a Marriott, and specifically a SpringHills. I was walking alone late on a Saturday night (I'm a 31-yr old guy) around the hotel, and I didn't feel particularly unsafe. There were no homeless people on the streets around the hotel during my stay. At the Arizona Center (3+ blocks away, about a 10-minute leisurely walk) there is "Sam's Cafe" (a local casual dining restaurant, a southwestern version of an Applebee's, sort of), a Greek restaurant, and other "faster" casual dining restaurants. I went for dinner at Sam's Cafe, and it was very reasonable (I had the Black & Bleu Quesadilla for $10), they even comp'ed me my Coke for free at the end of the meal (I sat at the bar). The free breakfast was pretty mediocre, in my opinion. Both the sausage and the eggs (are in the form like you'd get in a McDonald's Sausage Egg McMuffin, except they) taste mediocre and appear to be prepared from frozen. Let's just put it this way: after I had one sausage patty and one egg 'patty' you couldn't pay me $5 to eat more. The rest of the breakfast offerings were: orange or apple juice, coffee (decaf or caf), oatmeal, white or wheat bread with jellies, muffins, and a waffle machine where you can make your own waffles. Overall, a good value, especially if you're frequenting the Convention Center or US Airways Center or Chase Field. My advice: just consider other plans for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Chase Field Games”
Reviews.Author: pgrabar
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed here in late Sept. 2008, mainly to be within walking distance of Chase Field, home of the Arizona Diamondbacks. The hotel is just 3 blocks away from the ball park, an easy walk. It saves time and money not having to deal with the hassle of parking. On the way is a nice pub, the Rose and Crown, which features excellent lunches during the day, and a wide variety of drinks at night. The hotel itself, besides being in a handy location, has many things going for it. The airport shuttle was prompt, just 12 minutes to arrive. The breakfast area is large, and besides the usual cold items, also has hot waffles, eggs, and sausage. The rooms have a desk area, a sofa and chair opposite the desk area, a small wet bar, fridge, and counter, comfortable beds, a separate bathroom sink area, and a good shower, complete with a real mat. The staff were all helpful and friendly. All in all, an excellent hotel at a good rate and location. I'd certainly stay here again when in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Brig1977
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel close to Chase Field. We traveled over Labor Day weekend. This hotel was very clean, the room was very spacious, the staff was friendly, attentive and welcoming and the room rate was a great deal. (We booked directly through the hotel's website) The free breakfast buffet was a lot better than other hotels that claim to have a buffet. (It wasnt top notch, but a lot better than we expected) Aside from Chase Field and The US Airways center, there isn't much around (walking distance) but it's conveniently located by the 10 freeway - so a short drive to others places. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: phillies4life
Reviews.Content: We were exhausted after flying a red eye into Phoenix. We were picked up via complimentary shuttle at the airport and allowed to check in at 8:30 AM, almost unheard of. They then offered us complimentary breakfast upon check in. If you don't want to rent a car, this hotel is perfectly located not far from Chase Field and a number of restaurants. The room was spacious, beautifully appointed, and provided numerous amenities including FREE internet, a fitness room, and a more than adequate pool. Overall an A+++.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay and location for D'backs games”
Reviews.Author: GumboK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights (July 5th and 6th) mainly to be close to Chase Field, and the Diamondbacks/Padres game on 7/6. Although it is close, it is not 2 blocks, but rather about 5 blocks from the field. We walked there in about 7-10 minutes on a day when it was 108. Needless to say, we were glad to enter the air conditioned ballpark. Our experience is what a hotel stay should be. Reasonable rates, fairly new property, well maintained with clean, comfortable rooms and free parking. The suites, in addition to the bedroom and bath, have a small living room area, with a desk area combined with a small kitchenette. Bar sink, counter, refrigerator, coffeemaker and microwave are included along with storage cupboards below. All very convenient for travelers with cold items or those wanting to microwave. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows and linen nice and soft. We slept great both nights. The bathroom and sink area are separated by a door which we like, as one can shave/dress while the other is showering. The shower had good pressure and lots of hot water. No bath mat, nor anti-slip strips in the tub, however, and I found the footing a little slippery. The A/C was more than adequate. The room was a very comfortable temperature when we arrived, but we cranked it down a bit more. It was a little too cold at night, and we had to make some adjustments to get it right. It had a fixed louver, and it blew right onto the person closest to it in the bed during the night. That was one of our minor complaints. An adjustable louver that one could point up and out into the room would be a large improvement. The included continental breakfast served us well both mornings. Oatmeal with toppings, fresh fruit, bagels, muffins, donuts, cook your own Belgian waffles, cereal, yogurt, and all beverages. The only downside was the eggs (cooked in a round form), and the sausage. The eggs tasted powdered, and the sausage was not good. Maybe the cholesterol gods were in charge, as we tasted both, but threw them out. Yuck. We ventured to the pool on the second night. It is a small one, and as it is shallow, and it's in Phoenix in the summertime. Therefore, it was a hot one. At 10:00 PM it was probably 90+ degrees. The hot tub was nice and bubbly, but it was way too HOT (I'd guess 110 - 115). Could only stay in for a few minutes, but afterwards the pool felt relatively cool. The wired internet connection worked fine, but the wireless was intermittent. I could only get a very good connection (compared to excellent, which is ideal). As a result, sites took awhile to load, with some even timing out, which some business travelers would find annoying. We both thought that this was an excellent hotel room and a reasonable rate. We had a car so getting around was not a problem, but others without transportation should know that it is a little far from the downtown proper, and there would be a walk involved to get to restaurants, etc. . I had to concentrate to come up with the few minor points that I mentioned, and they were only minor annoyances. I would recommend this hotel highly, as we enjoyed our stay thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tweetiepie99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill suites on Sunday the 10th of June. We chosen this hotel as it is 2 blocks from Chase Field where we were going to see the Red Sox play the Diamondbacks. We paid $99 plus taxes/ £56 for bed & breakfast. We loved this hotel, the room was very nice and clean the bed very comfy and the separate lounge area was great. There was a desk with internet access if you had a laptop and a sink/ fridge/ microwave area if you wanted to eat in. The room was facing the road but we hear no noise. The pool area was very nice and a decent size and open until 11pm which makes a nice change. The breakfast was also a nice surprise and we expected some bagels and coffee but you had option of sausage, eggs, cereal, bagels, muffins, donuts and a waffle iron to make your own fresh waffles! This kept us going all the way back to Vegas. There was also the use of the business centre with 2 computers and printers, all free of charge. The staff were also very pleasant and allowed us to check in early and chose the floor our room was on. All in all we will definitely stay here again when we come back to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the SpringHill Suites”
Reviews.Author: platynum1
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a week-long stay at SpringHill and will echo the views of most of the writers below. Some AMENITIES include a free shuttle to/from the airport (until 11pm), a small snack shop selling chips, cookies, drinks, etc., and a free business center. There is also a laundry room on the 2nd floor, which as of this writing costs per load $1.00 to wash and $1.00 to dry. The STAFF is very helpful and provide quick check-in, great recommendations and directions. The LOCATION is not great if you don't have a car. Of course there is the bus system (the #3 stops right in front of the hotel), and the free DASH, which goes around the downtown area, stops about 3 blocks before getting to the hotel, along Van Buren. If you're not used to walking, it is a distance from the convention center (about 8 blocks) and very far from the arena where the Suns play (maybe 14 blooks); but closer to the baseball field and a 4 blocks from the Arizona Center (a small but relaxing mall). The ROOM was clean and a good size, had a very comfortable bed, one television, small refrigerator & microwave, coffee maker and plenty of lighting. The sink is separate from the tub/toilet, which may allow more than one person to get ready for the day, and there is a decent-sized closet and plenty of drawer space. The BREAKFAST was very good, especially if you're going to be in workshops all day. There is hot food - including waffles, eggs & sausage, cereal, fruit, yogurt, muffins, juice, etc. Only know that it's the same setup every day, so pick and choose your daily selections knowing that if you don't have something today, you can have a shot at it tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Attkica
Reviews.Content: Only a couple of blocks from the baseball stadium. It is an easy walk to a game. Nice clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not great for walking to the convention center, or anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: ehbnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal but the location isn't good if you think you're going to go anywhere on foot. First the good--the rooms were great for business travel and I appreciated the free wireless internet and the better-than-average free breakfast. Nothing was fancy but everything was clean and in good shape. I liked the setup of the room--there was a little office area and a little living room area and a comfy bed. The downside was really about Phoenix more than the hotel--you can't walk *anywhere* safely, especially as a woman and most especially at night. The convention center is not far away but I was the only person on foot except for some very disturbed homeless people, so I had to take 5-minute cab rides every day. There is no real food onsite except for breakfast, and there are not a lot of good places to eat downtown and none within walking distance. Skip the "mexican" food at Sam's at the local mall unless you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative for central Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: M-Csala
Reviews.Content: When the other main places to stay downtown are the Hyatt Regency and the Wyndham - and you're not getting a convention rate - then this is definitely the place to stay. My husband and I were here for two nights, just as tourists. We do need to travel with our laptop, and found the high-speed (wired) internet service to be quick & easy to access. We are Marriott Rewards Points members, and used points to stay here free, but got no extra perks, since the place was full when we checked in. We called from Sky Harbor airport, and their shuttle took us right to the hotel. The room was basically the same as all other Springhills, with a desk-living area, small fridge, and sofa with coffee table. A big coffeepot too, and a huge bathroom area, with large but separate toilet & shower. Roomy closet with plentiful hangers & luggage stand, plus ironing board and iron. The included breakfast buffet was HUGE, and enough was always on hand even though all the rooms were full. The TV channels were rather limited for being in a big city, but the Manager told me she's aware of the problem and is working with the cable company to remedy that. She and another employee also went out of her way to do us several favors. When I needed to get to a drugstore to get some personal items, she took the shuttle van and personally drove me to a Wal-Green's! There are no restaurants right near the hotel, however we found plenty at the Arizona Center just 5 blocks down (highly recommend Sam's Cafe), as well as in a few other areas. Heritage Square was close by, and anything else we wanted to get to was reachable by using the city's FREE DASH busses - they are great!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed-up reservations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had heard this was a nice place and booked reservations because it's close to Chase Field and US Airways Arena. I booked through hotel's web site. Requested smoking room and got the message "not available." Tried non-smoking and got the same message! I called the hotel and was assured I could have a smoking room. When I arrived to check in, no smoking rooms were available. Was told I could have a first-floor room and stand outside and smoke in 110 degree weather. No thanks. This is a good location. Just wish the desk people could get their act together. Ended up going someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlzafron
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels/motels I stayed in on my Arizona trip, this was the nicest and cleanest. It had a convenient and free airport shuttle, a decent sized room, adequate amenities, very good continental breakfast (eggs, sausage patties, waffles, toast, muffins, fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc.), comfortable beds, etc. The location was a little dicey, but then I gather downtown Phoenix can be that way too. It's walking distance to the convention center, some of the main hotels, and the stadium stuff. Staff were very pleasant. This is a good pick for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Would highly recomend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business convention. The manager was a very nice lady and caring. Had a mix-up with our daughter arriving late and the desk clerk told her they could not pick her up after 11:00pm with the hotel shuttle. I was having a conversation with the manager the next morning and told her about it. She promply paid me for the cab fair I had to pay to get my daughter there even though I told her I did not want it. She paid the amount $20.00 even on my word. The staff was very freindly, the rooms clean. I stayed for 7 days was always greeted with very freindly staff. I would recomend this motel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: LAPhil13
Reviews.Content: Room was fine -- very nice beds. Location was convenient to my work, which is the reason I was there. Front desk staff was very friendly in my limited contact w/them. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Marriotts are wonderful this one was AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: the_undertaker
Reviews.Content: i was told by the desk in phoenix i didnt need a credit card to check in if i was paying cash, so i didnt bring it with me. they wouldnt check me in till i got them a copy of the credit card. so someone had to run all over town to get them a photocopy of this credit card so they check me in. It took me 2 hours to check in. I should of left at that point. but because marriott are very good places, i decided to stay. when i got to my room it was freezing cold. ( penguins could of ice skated in the bathroom) so i turned off the ac thinking this is phoenix and in 10 minits it be hotter than blue blazes in here. So i left the room when i came back that night it was still cold. So i turned on the heat and the fire alarm went off. When i called to complain they told me they give me points for the stay and as to say there sorry all i got as 1000 for there sorry and NONE for staying there. i called them back and they tried to say i payed less than i did but i had the reciept so they had to give me the correct point (this only took 2-3 phone calls) Finally a manger called and gave me 10000 points unstead of a free stay (would you wanna go back after that) . will I ever stay at that hotel again? HECK NO! Dont get me wrong about marriott hotels MOST are real nice ones. If you stay in full service marriott, or a courtyard they are wonderful hotel you will be fine. Ive even been told the Residence Inn are quite nice. Ive never stayed in one of them myself. This perticular hotel is a disaster! so dont make the mastake of staying in this hotel

HotelInfo.Name: SpringHill Suites Phoenix Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 802 East Van Buren Street, Phoenix, AZ 85006
